He prayed that since all the material activities are part of the Lord
are performed by the mind in terms of actions and reactions of the material senses and he
since was going back to godhead the mind would wind up its material activities and be turned
towards the transcendental service of the lord there was no longer a need for material activities
actually the activities of the mind cannot be stopped for they are the reflection of the
eternal soul but the quality of the activities can be changed from the matter to the transcendental
service of the lord the material color of the mind is changed when one washes it from the
contamination of life breathing and thereby frees it from the contamination of repeated
births and deaths and situates it in pure spiritual life all is manifested by the
temporary
embodiment of the material body which is production of mind at the time of death
production of mind at the time of death and if the mind is purified by the practice of
transcendental loving service to the lord and is constantly engaged in the service of the lotus
feet of the lord there is no more chance of the minds producing another material body after death
it will be freed from absorption in material contamination the pure soul will be able to
to return home, back to Godhead. Thus ends the Bhaktivedanta Parvati. Here, the yogic
practice of Yudhishthira is explained. So this shows, this particular verse from the
15th chapter of Srimad Bhagavatam, first canto, where the title of the chapter is,
The Pandavas Retire Timely. The timely retire of the Pandavas. So Pandavas now, because
Krishna has winded up his pastimes, so Pandavas also, who are eternal associates of the Lord,
also decide to wind up their activities and go back to home, back to Godhead.
So that is the scenario where Yudhishthira, Arjuna and all other Pandavas wish to go back
to home, back to Godhead, not to remain here in this material world. So this chapter is
very wonderfully named as The Pandavas Retire Timely. Means, each and every living being
in this planet, should be aware that timely we should retire from the material activities
and focus our self to go back to home, back to Godhead. Not to get stuck, not to get attracted
to this material world so much that we keep doing our material activities till the last breath.
Not that the person would die thinking of his properties, thinking of his family members,
thinking of all the wealth which he has created and what will happen next to it. No. When there
is sufficient energy in the body, a person in the Vedic culture, now it's a Kali Yuga,
the scenario may be slightly different, there is a solution for that. But however, in the
Dwapara Yuga, you can go back to the pastimes, you can go back to the pastimes, you can go
back to the pastimes, you can go back to the pastimes, you can go back to the pastimes,
you can see the process which was maintained in Vedic culture is to retire. Pandavas still
had sufficient energy in their body, but they decided to retire because they found out,
they have nominated the next person to occupy the throne, their grandson, Pariksit. Now it's
the time that duties are over, they have to focus on going back to home, back to Godhead.
that is the beauty of the vedic culture where the kshatriyas or anybody for that matter
as their children grow they give up the their all the attraction for material things look for higher
things this can happen only if we are trained from our childhood because attraction for the

it is possible to give up only if somebody has sufficient knowledge the transcendental knowledge

What color appears in your mind?
